adjectives.description: brisky (comparative more brisky, superlative most brisky)

examples: [H]e kept his eyes steadily fixed upon the ground, and walked at a brisky pace, as if desirous of getting out of the city as quickly as possible.

nouns.description: brisky (plural form uncertain: briskys or briskies)

entries.meaning: (rare, probably obsolete, possibly nonstandard) A britchka, a type of horse-drawn carriage.
examples: Och! and wouldn't it be a blessed thing for your spirrits if ye cud lay your two peepers jist, upon Sir Pathrick O'Grandison, Barronitt, when he is all riddy drissed for the hopperer, or stipping into the Brisky for the drive into the Hyde Park.
